Package it.polimi.ingsw.GUI

Class GUIHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.GUI.GUIHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<MessageHandler>
public class GUIHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<MessageHandler>
It is the interface of GUI towards and backwards network. It is responsible of every message which is sent on the net and received from it.

  • Method Details

    • loadFXMLFile

      public void loadFXMLFile​(javafx.scene.Node node, javafx.stage.Stage nextStage, java.lang.String fileToLoad)
      It opens a new stage, loading a new scene based on the FXML file "fileToLoad". It closes the previous stage.
      Parameters:
      node - An element of the previous stage. It is needed to close that one.
      nextStage - It is the stage to set.
      fileToLoad - FXML file to load on the scene.

    • setClientConnection

      public boolean setClientConnection()
      It establishes the connection with the server.
      Returns:
      true if the server is active, false otherwise.

    • askNameAvailability

      public boolean askNameAvailability​(java.lang.String nickname)
      It asks the server if the chosen nickname is available.
      Parameters:
      nickname - It is the nickname chosen by the client.
      Returns:
      true if the nickname is available, false otherwise.

    • readString

      public java.lang.String readString()
      It reads a String message sent by the server. If there are no messages, it waits until a message comes.
      Returns:
      the read message.

    • readSerializableLG

      public SerializableLiteGame readSerializableLG()
      It reads a SerializableLiteGame message sent by the server. If there are no messages, it waits until a message comes.
      Returns:
      the read message.

    • update

      public void update​(MessageHandler message)
      It sets updateString or updateLG and notifies all sleeping threads.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<MessageHandler>
      Parameters:
      message - : message received from the observable instance

    • addGod

      public void addGod​(God currGod, javafx.scene.control.Label label1, javafx.scene.control.Label label2, javafx.scene.control.Label label3)
      It fills the attribute gods and modifies labels on screen, containing chosen gods' name.
      Parameters:
      currGod - The god to be added to the list.
      label1 - First label on screen.
      label2 - Second label on screen.
      label3 - Third label on screen.

    • getGods

      public java.util.List<God> getGods()

    • sendChallengerMessage

      public void sendChallengerMessage()
      It sends the challengerMessage to the server.

    • setMessageFromFrontend

      public void setMessageFromFrontend​(java.lang.String message)
      It parses the message containing all the gods chosen by the challenger.
      Parameters:
      message - It contains the gods chosen by the challenger.

    • setClientMessage

      public void setClientMessage​(God currGod)
      It sets the clientMessage to be sent to the server. If the client isn't the challenger, it sends this message too.
      Parameters:
      currGod - It is the god chosen by the client.
